Notes: Twin-engine 5th-gen with Type 1475 KLJ-5 AESA radar (400 km detection vs. 3mÂ²), internal bays for 6 PL-15/PL-21 BVR missiles, and low RCS for first-look/kill; two-seat S variant enhances networked ops with KJ-500 cueing to 280 km envelope; fleet hit 300+ with 200 produced in 2025 across 13+ brigades.

Carrier-capable 5th-gen (PLANAF focus) with WS-13/WS-19 engines, AESA radar, and 4-6 internal PL-15s for stealthy BVR; initial operational capability achieved mid-2025 on Fujian carrier; supports datalink fusion for 250+ km engagements, bridging J-20 and carrier strike groups.

4.5-gen heavy fighter with JL-17 AESA radar (300 km range), 12 external PL-15/PL-21 pylons, and Khibiny-style EW; D variant (12 units) for jamming enemy radars to enable BVR salvos; core of PLAAF strike force, with 50+ added in 2025 for hybrid ops with drones.

Single-engine 4.5-gen with KLJ-7A AESA (170 km), fly-by-wire, and 6-8 PL-15 missiles; excels in agile BVR with HOJ (high-off-boresight) capability and indigenous datalinks; 30+ delivered in 2025, forming 10+ squadrons for forward defense.

Upgraded Flanker with indigenous WS-10 engines, N001VE radar (150 km), and 8 PL-12/PL-15 loads; BS variant adds conformal tanks for extended loiter; reliable BVR backbone (445 PLAAF + 50 PLANAF), integrated with ground radars for cueing.

Twin-seat long-range platform with N001VEP radar (200 km), thrust-vectoring, and 12 R-77/PL-12 missiles; MK2 naval variant (24 PLANAF) for carrier ops; sustains BVR via AEW links, with upgrades focusing on Chinese avionics compatibility.

Flanker-derived carrier jet with improved WS-10 engines, KLJ-5A radar, and 6-8 PL-12/PL-15 pylons; T variant (10) with catapult compatibility, D (6) for EW; 59 base + variants operational on Liaoning/Shandong, extending naval BVR to 200 km.

Y-9-based AEW with AESA radar (450 km horizon) for off-board targeting and mid-course PL-15 updates; 40 PLAAF + 20+ PLANAF; critical for networked BVR, with refueling probes added in 2025 for persistent coverage.
